item.title: UP DMMME Faculty awarded with the Ian Morley Prize by the University of Queensland
item.description: UP DMMME faculty member, Assistant Professor Djoan Kate T. Tungpalan, was recently awarded with the Ian Morley Prize by the Julius Kruttschnitt Minerals Research Center (JKMRC) of the University of Queensland for her overall excellent performance in her dissertation study entitled "Development of a novel methodology for flowsheet design and evaluation in prefeasibility/feasibility projects" and her contributions to the overall cultural life of the mining and minerals engineering
item.content:encoded:
UP DMMME faculty member, Assistant Professor Djoan Kate T. Tungpalan, was recently awarded with the Ian Morley Prize by the Julius Kruttschnitt Minerals Research Center (JKMRC) of the University of Queensland for her overall excellent performance in her dissertation study entitled "Development of a novel methodology for flowsheet design and evaluation in prefeasibility/feasibility projects" and her contributions to the overall cultural life of the mining and minerals engineering community.
Assistant Professor Djoan Kate T. Tungpalan (rightmost) receiving the Ian Morley Shield from no less than the children of Mr. Ian Morley whose photo is shown in the background.
       Despite her very busy research schedule, Prof. Tungpalan still had time to serve as head of the student body organization at the JKMRC and the organization of Filipino-Australian students in UQ.  Apart from that, she has been involved in a project called "Designer Tailings", which is a collaborative project among the different centers of the Sustainable Mining Institute (SMI) of UQ.  She is also involved in collaborative projects of UQ with the Mining Consortium of the Philippines currently composed of some of the universities offering Mining Education namely, University of the Philippines-Diliman, Mindanao Institute of Technology-Iligan and General Santos campuses, and the University of Southeastern Philippines.
This prestigious award essentially immortalized Prof. Tungpalan as her name is now written on the Ian Morley Shield, together with the other winners in the past 25 years.  In the history of this award, Professor Tungpalan is only the 4th woman awardee apart from being the silver jubilee awardee, which made it more special.
The Ian Morley Prize was established in honor of the contributions of Mr. Ian Morley to the growth and development of the mining industry in Australia including his contributions to the mining education, primarily through his works at the University of Queensland.
Professor Tungpalan is currently completing her research work at the University of Queensland under the supervision of Dr. Luke Keeney, Dr. Elaine Wightman, and most especially, Prof. Emmy Manlapig, who is also an esteemed alumnus of the UP Metallurgical Engineering Program and the 2014 UPAE Professional Awardee for Engineering Education. 
 Assistant Professor Djoan Kate T. Tungpalan (third from right) with the JKMRC Board of Trustees (on her right) and the children of Mr. Ian Morely (on her left).Assistant Professor Djoan Kate T. Tungpalan (third from right) with the JKMRC Board of Trustees (on her right) and the children of Mr. Ian Morely (on her left).

item.content:encoded:
September 5, 2014 - DMMME MS MSE student, Michael R. Tan was awarded as the Best Presenter at the 2014 3rd International Conference on Engineering and Innovative Materials held at Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia for the paper entitled "Electroless Deposition of Copper Nanostructures in Aqueous Solution". Undergraduate students from the Sustainable Electronic Materials Laboratory, Lance de Jesus, Kathy Lois Amores, and Ellaine Datu also contributed to the project which is being led by Dr. Mary Donnabelle L. Balela.
Two other DMMME graduate students were invited to present their papers as well. Christian Mark Pelicano presented his study entitled "Growth of Zinc Oxide Nanostructures from Zinc foil" while Nathan de Guzman and Aurelia Mechilina presented the study "Electroless Deposition of Silver Nanoparticles and Nanowires in Ethylene Glycol". The studies will be published in Advanced Materials Research Journal (ISSN: 1022-6680) as a special issue.

item.content:encoded:
Faculty members and students of the Department of Mining, Metallurgical and Materials Engineering (DMMME) participated in the first Institute of Materials Engineers of the Philippines (IMEP) Conference with the theme “Advancing Technologies in the Philippines through Materials Science and Engineering Education, Research, and Practice”, successfully held last 31 July 2014 at the Eastwood Richmonde Hotel in Quezon City.
Participants of the 1st IMEP Conference
The keynote address was delivered by the Undersecretary for Research and Development of the Department of Science and Technology Dr. Amelia P. Guevara. Visiting professors from Japan, namely Prof. Hisao Yanagi and Prof. Michiya Fujiki of the Nara Institute of Science and Technology also shared their expertise in materials engineering research. Moreover, a number of faculty members from DMMME, including Dr. Magdaleno R. Vasquez, Jr., Dr. Manolo G. Mena, Dr. Alberto V. Amorsolo, Jr., and Dr. Leslie Joy L. Diaz, have also been invited speakers in the said conference.
The paper entitled Production of Amorphous and Crystalline Silica from Philippine Waste Rice Hull of Ms. Emie S. Mirasol and Dr. Rinlee Butch M. Cervera from DMMME bagged the Best Poster Award.
Dr. Manolo G. Mena during his presentation entitled:
“Semiconductor Packaging- Living in a Material World”
About IMEP [1]
The Institute of Materials Engineers of the Philippines, also known as IMEP, traces its humble beginnings when the twelve incorporators assembled with the intention of strengthening and further promoting the materials engineering field through the formation of a professional society. As the only organization of its kind in the country, IMEP aims to actively engage in education, practice, and dissemination of technical information in the field of materials engineering through its cooperation with government and private institutions.
In May 31, 2013, IMEP was recognized by the Securities and Exchange Commission as a non-stock, non-profit organization. The first general assembly, attended by 59 founding members, was held in July 6, 2013 at the DMMME of the University of the Philippines in Diliman (UP Diliman) Quezon City. It was in the same day that the first Board of Directors was elected. The oath taking took place in Nov. 23, 2013 during the 1st IMEP Annual Meeting (iMEET), which was held at the University Hotel, UP Diliman. During the iMEET, the official logo created by Ms. Catherine Kaye Garrido was also launched.
For more information about IMEP, you may visit www.imep-org.inc or email your queries to imep.inc@gmail.com.
[1] Cruz, John Kenneth A. 2014. History of IMEP. IMEP 2014 Conference Proceedings.
Photographs © Myra Ruth Poblete and Karlo Leandro Baladad

DMMME faculty members and graduate students led by Dr. Magdaleno R. Vasquez, Jr., Chairman of the Department, participated in the ERDT Congress 2014 held on 25 July 2014 at the SMX Convention Center with the theme "Science and Technology for Disaster Preparedness and Resiliency."   
Disasters, particularly typhoon, with its associated events like flooding and storm surge, and earthquake were highlighted in the Congress. Technologies that provided understanding and various means to predict and address these disasters were presented by experts from the College of Engineering of UP Diliman and UP Los Banos, UP College of Social Work and Community Development, UP Marine Science Institute, University of Twente, PhilVolcs, the Local Government of Albay, and the Climate Change Commission.

Poster presentations were also conducted by ERDT scholars including Mr. Lorenz Anthony T. Fernando, a graduate student from the Department pursuing a Master of Science degree in Materials Science and Engineering and a member of the Composite Materials Research Laboratory.

item.content:encoded:
Six DMMME faculty members participated in the second and final leg of the IDEA Global Entrepreneurship Workshop Series last July 25-27, 2014 at the Asian Institute of Management, Makati. Three out of the six faculty members, namely, Astrid Ayla Liberato, Eduardo Magdaluyo, Jr., and Jill Manapat, have successfully completed the entire workshop series by attending the first leg last March 14-15, 2014 in the same venue.
Some of UP College of Engineering's faculty members and researchers with one of IDEA workshop's facilitators, Mr. Eros Resmini (Photo credit: AAELiberato)
IDEA, which stands for Innovative Development for Entrepreneurship Advancement, is a three-year program pioneered by the Philippine S&T Development Foundation (PhilDev S&T) that aims “to create a sustainable entrepreneurial ecosystem in the Philippines [1].” Some of the projects under the said program include the workshop series and an annual symposium, the first of which was also attended by DMMME faculty members and researchers last March 17, 2014 at the Edsa Shangri-La Hotel.
The facilitators of the workshop series were Ahmet Alpdemir and Eros Resmini, both experienced entrepreneurs from Silicon Valley. Seven topics were discussed as follows: market demand, strategic planning and modeling, customer validation, competitive analysis, sound execution plan, company building, and solid financial support. A talk on intellectual property practice in the Philippines was also conducted by Atty. Peter Calimag who served as the Assistant Secretary for Revenue Operations & Legal Affairs from 2010-2012 at the Department of Finance. Participants of the workshop included start-up entrepreneurs, educators, students, and industry representatives among others.
DMMME is committed in promoting an entrepreneurial spirit among its faculty and students in order to ensure that research projects are translated into products and services that are useful to society. As proof of this commitment, curricular changes are on-going for all DMMME programs in order to introduce a design research track as well as entrepreneurship into the curriculum. 
[1] http://phildev.org/wp/idea/

item.content:encoded:
Faculty members and researchers from DMMME attended the one-day Metrohm Autolab Electrochemistry Day organized by Dynalab Corporation last July 7, 2014 at the De La Salle University, Manila. The speaker, Mr. Luca Pini, discussed the basics of electrochemistry, impedance spectroscopy, and instrumentation, specifically on how to use the potentiostat/galvanostat for different applications in electrodeposition, corrosion, energy, and environmental electrochemistry among other topics.
DMMME faculty members and researchers with Mr. Luca Pini (Photo credit: AAELiberato)
DMMME currently has a Metrohm Autolab potentiostat/galvanostat in its Smart and Functional Materials Laboratory. The said equipment is being used for studies involving batteries, solid polymer electrolytes, soil purification, and other related research projects.
